reviewText: I have and will always be a fan of Morris Chestnut. From his first movie Boyz N Tha Hood he has captured me and to this day anything he is in I will support. This was good and I always love plays. I recommend this to anyone who needs to let go and move on. Love comes when you least expect it and not looking but like God always on time.
Loved the play.  Shared it with my mom, and she loved it too.  Hold out for the right man girls! Don't settle!!(Smile) And by all means, never judge a book by it's cover.  Hmmmmmmm
The play gets three stars. The singing gets two stars. The price for the dvd should have been lower. Overall, I give this play two stars because of the singing.

This is an excellent play well done by David E Talbert. He is so different from Tyler Perry so don't compare the two. I was fortunate to see this play live on tour when it stopped in Trenton, NJ 2 years ago. Enjoy. You will feel so many emotions while watching but the most important thing is that you will be entertained. Highly recommend. Everything that David E Talbert puts out is excellent

I must say that I actually go this DVD because of Morris Chestnut and it was not what I thought it would be. This was the first play that I have seen on DVD so maybe it just did not have to same affect like if I was actually in the audience. The story line was ok. My husband did not like it atol. To each its own.
Love it

SPOILER ALERT: Wow, very great play!  I wish I would have seen it in person, but hey, at least I saw it!  To the Talberts- I can edit if that's what is needed.  Ms. Dee-Dee said she doesn't talk about her men folk and what they do in the bed, but there was a scene with just her and Tyme, and Dee Dee told all her biz about how long her guy was and how she wasn't going to wait on him. Yeah several innuendos about sex and a penis.  I like the concepts of "there are still good men out there; forgiveness; and don't take your relationship woes out on your child."  This play is really geared for us ladies IMHO.  There's a few things in here for the fellas, but not much.  Shout out to the "Naturalistas" out there.  As Avant could only sing it-keep your cornrows, afros, and stay away from those chemicals.  Please keep Avant in your plays Mr. Talbert-really enjoyed him and Ms. Ellia!  God Bless!
Love it!
I like it
Loved it, it was funny, singing was great and the casting was great. I would definitely recommend this to a friend.
I forgot that I have the Play already. It is a good play and I love Morris Chestnut. I recommend it for everyone to watch.
great play great actors  all so a very good lesson llearned for people in love.
Awesome play

Love this dvd....another one for Talbert's plays
I really enjoyed this play and i will purchase more in the future.

Not only was the quality of this production fantastic, but casting, acting, and overall storyline was genius. I would recommend this for anyone who knows anything about the complications of love.

David E. Talbert's Love in the Nick of Tyme is a nice, well put together stage play. The story flows nice and all comes together. However, there were some things I did dislike about the play. The cast didn't seem to have chemistry which messed up the flow. But it was overall a nice play to watch.
I was disappointment because I was hoping for a movie.  I don't like to watch plays on DVD.  I love Morris Chestnut though so at least it is in my collection.

Thought this play was well done. There were a Few good laughs. I thought that the main point having love and not cherishing that love was well communicated. I gave it three stars because, although it was an enjoyable play there seemed rot be something lacking and couldn't quite figure what that was. You'll get some laughs and David leaves you with something to ponder.
I have never seen such Stupid play, we are living in a new time, don't don't No man or Woman take mess like this, David you had a Good actor, the play was as Madea would say" Crazy as Hell""
I loved this, it is an amazing play. I'd recommend this to all who enjoy plays.a must see. 5 stars all the way.
This is my favorite play of all time. The acting was superb, the story was great, and the directing was awesome. David E. Talbert is always on his game.
Loved this video. So glad I signed up for Prime. I recommended Prime to my friends but they already have it. Red box is stiff competition but I still prefer Prime for ease of use.
this was actually pretty good for a stage play. and the fact that morris was in it was just oooh. i don't like all the singing but it was pretty balanced out so it wasn't too bad.
I love stage plays but this one is my favorite of all time.  For those who enjoy watching plays, this is a must see . . . . . .
I liked this play. I was really good. It teaches us to value what we have because we may not be able to keep it if we neglect it.
Morris played a good role, and always he looks good in it. I just wish it could of been longer. It's worth watching.
One day whiley watching T.V. I just came across this movie and I knew I had to buy it. The movie itself was in great shape when I recived it. Cindy

David Talbert is another one of my favorite playwrights....  When I saw this play I knew that I had to add it to my collection of plays and movies.. (i'm running out of room and have to buy another storage area for my dvd's)  If you have every loved and lost then you need to see this... Especially with Mr. Fine himself Morris Chestnut!
This was the 2nd time I have viewed any of Talbert's movies. I experienced all the emotions of being happy, sad, mad and cheering at the end. Great DVD!
i seen this play on bet and had to get it dvd in new condition and also very good to watch
This happens to so many people. Never realizing what you have until it's gone. You can only take advantage of a person for so long.
It is a very good play, strong actors and a lot of talent. All that and then Mr. Morris Chestnut who is the whipped cream topping. Very nicely done.

Yup , I am only giving this play 1 star because Morris was in it. The characters are so flat and bland, the play lacks a foundation and substantial plot. Eye candy is about the only positive with this movie, found myself fast forwarding throughout just to skip over the overdramatized singing solos. This was a waste of my time. It was wack wack wackitty wack. The end.
The play was very good. I really enjoyed the acting and the singing. Morris chestnut did a great job of being the bad guy in the play and the actress playing his girl was also good.
And this one was a great addition to my collection. This is another play that I purchased solely off of the reviews and I don't regret it one bit. I recommend the item and the seller to everyone.
I HAVE NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE YET STILL WAITING ON SOME OF MY FAMILY MEMBER TO WATCH IT WITH ME.
Morris Chesnut is sexy as hell! he was the main reason why I bought the play but I an glad that I enjoyed it. The storyline was great and the music was good as well

Delivery and communication from seller was great. This play was mediocre at best. It had a great meaning and story line, sometimes it just appeared that the actresses weren't into it as much as maybe i wouldve liked. David E. Talbert is a great writer, producer, slash everything. Keep up the good work.

I absolutely Loved this play.. Morris Chestnut is such a good looking Black man and the cast was simply beautiful. There was some good singing in this play!!! Avant and Trenyce should have "sang more" but still great. The story line is one all women can identify with and Love the ending!!! Must add this to your collection.
I really enjoyed this play.  It was funny and very refreshing, however I was sad that David had no mention of God or faith in God in the play.
This movie is really good.  It is funny, sad, and at times will make you mad, but you will keep watching to see what happens next.  Just good, good, and so good.
LOVE IT
